The type of dbusInfo if difference between state effecter and numeric effecter.
In EffecterInfo struct, I added:
    std::vector<DBusNumericEffecterMapping>
        dbusNumericEffecterInfo; //!< D-Bus information for the effecter id
to update the numeric effecter info. I can't use state effecter struct DBusEffecterMapping for numeric effecter.
Done
this code is duplicated in the same file.
Ack
if we are okay to set the effecter even without knowing the host state..then why do we need it ?
The code is used to configure the numeric effecter for both host and others terminus type. So the user can use "checkHostState": false" configuration to bypass host checking if need.
The checking is required when the D-Bus is created by other services but not pldmd. Because in those service, the D-Bus still can exist event the host is off.
this just does not help , please improve the error traces.
Ack
same here too.. which effecter ?
Ack
magic number

The PLDM_SET_NUMERIC_EFFECTER_VALUE_MIN_REQ_BYTES is for 1 byte dateSize. When the dataSize is change two 2, 4 bytes we need add 1 and 3.
It is similar as below code:
https://github.com/openbmc/pldm/blob/c021dbc88a4b7009941a72c95c108c03c1409d10/libpldm/platform.c#L478
I think, its better to have a const value defined for this 1 and 3 to easily find out what it is ?

The code will be updated after adding new Constant in libpldm is approved.
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/71660
The same comment for the similar comment.

As the discussion in the comment https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/libpldm/+/71660/comment/51cfdf7a_17df45d0/
Adding the constant to remove the magic number is incomplete solution. The API to response the request/response message size should be added as completely solution.
These magic number in this patch set will be removed at when that API is added.

doxygen missing.
Ack
why is this moved out of libpldmresponder ?
As my opinion, HostEffecterParser will send the PLDM request from BMC to the terminus so it should not be inside of `#ifdef LIBPLDMRESPONDER`
Moreover, the dbus_to_host_effecter can be applied for all PLDM terminus but not only host. In other comment, I suggest to change the file name to `dbus_to_terminus_effecter`.
why is this needed? we could have the handler only when we have host as this is `dbus-to-host-effecter` ?
reason for having this check? as the code piece is dbus-to-host-effecter
As above comment.
Hey @Thu, The code structure looks good but can we brief why do we need this host On check and why was it not needed for the state effecter? What's the reasoning behind it?

> Hey @Thu, The code structure looks good but can we brief why do we need this host On check. and why was it not needed for the state effecter? What's the reasoning behind it?

Actually, we have the `host On check` in the current code for state effecter.
https://github.com/openbmc/pldm/blob/master/host-bmc/dbus_to_host_effecters.cpp#L166

That why, in this patch set, I also include `host On Check`. But to apply the code for other PLDM terminus (none-host terminus), I add the `checkHostState` option.
When this option is set, the `host On Check` will be applied as the current `state effecter`.

lg2

how did we come up with only these fields? We could also have `baseUnit` field right which is unique for effecters

As table `Table 47 – SetNumericEffecterValue command format` in DSP0248_V1.2.2, the `SetNumericEffecterValue` only need the effecterValue and fffecterDataSize.
So I don't think we need baseUnit.
These fields are added to allow we convert the value on D-Bus to the effecter raw value.
why do we call it terminusNumericEffecter and not NumericEffecter alone?

Just because I saw that we are using `setHostStateEffecter` name.
https://github.com/openbmc/pldm/blob/master/host-bmc/dbus_to_host_effecters.cpp#L262C25-L262C45
